definition: (of an employee) to clock on (or off)/to punch in (or out)/(Tw) (on Facebook) to check in to a location
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
dozen (loanword)
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

sentences.english: Jason usually punches in around 8:50 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 杰生通常大约在早上八点五十打卡上班。

sentences.english: The question is, why did he not touch his punch-card when he is a person who always touches his punch-card.
sentences.chinese: 问题是他是一个经常打卡的人，为何他不打卡。

sentences.english: The question is, why did he not touch his punch-card when he is a person who always touches his punch-card.
sentences.chinese: 问题是他是一个经常打卡的人，为何他不打卡。

sentences.english: For the record, he is very diligent with his punch-card.
sentences.chinese: 根据记录，他是一位对打卡非常在意的人。

sentences.english: She asked one of his colleague to punch card for her.
sentences.chinese: 同时，帮其代打卡的同事贾某因替她打卡也被解雇。

sentences.english: She asked one of his colleague to punch card for her.
sentences.chinese: 同时，帮其代打卡的同事贾某因替她打卡也被解雇。

sentences.english: Sometimes I feel as though I should have a punch-in time clock before I walk out on-stage.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我似乎应当在出场之前有台打卡机。

sentences.english: The clock was already broken when I came.
sentences.chinese: 我来的时候打卡钟已经坏了。

sentences.english: Yeah, we should remember to clock in everyday.
sentences.chinese: 是啊，每天都要记着打卡。

sentences.english: Don't forget to punch your timecard before leaving the office.
sentences.chinese: 离开办公室前不要忘了打卡。

sentences.english: Provided time record of one employee is missing specific time-in and time-out.
sentences.chinese: 一名员工的考勤记录缺少具体的上下班打卡时间。

sentences.english: During the office hour, anybody who punches the cock 15 minutes later should ask for a leave.
sentences.chinese: 上班时间，15分钟以后打卡者须以请假办理。

sentences.english: I clock out, race home through our wincing little town.
sentences.chinese: 我打卡下班，飞车穿过凋零的小镇往家赶。

sentences.english: Don‘t forget to clock in,otherwise you won‘t get paid.
sentences.chinese: 别忘了打卡，否则领不到钱。

sentences.english: It was a Friday night and Dr. James Valek had clocked out for the day.
sentences.chinese: 又是一个礼拜五傍晚，已打卡下班的詹姆斯。

sentences.english: 51TestDon‘t forget to clock in,otherwise you won‘t get paid.

notebook/pocket diary
mutual supervision

to study outside of class time (reviewing one's lessons)/to study in one's free time/individual study
to take a picture

server push (computing)
to attend a class/to go to a lecture
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
oh (interjection indicating doubt or surprise)
to chant
every day/everyday
